website_summaries.verdict: A great touchpad solution for Windows users who want a solid and inexpensive alternative to a wireless mouse.
pros: Wired design saves money on batteries
cons: The PERIPAD-501 was exclusively designed for use with Windows 7, 8, and 10 PCs

customer_reviews.title: It works great.
customer_reviews.text: This touchpad is great. It's lightweight and feels okay on your hand. It worked fine on my laptop running Ubuntu, my dad's laptop running Windows 10 and my mom's laptop running Windows 10 LTSC. It's worked perfectly every time I've used it. I would definitely recommend this touchpad to anyone looking for an external touchpad or a mouse alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Josue Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Will not scroll - instead of scrolling, it zooms
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. All works good except for the scroll which I use a lot. If you surf the web or read documents that needs scrolling up and down a page, this is the not the product for you. Scrolling is detected with the multi finger gesture. I tried many times with different position and posture. Instead of scrolling, it zooms for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Siu

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I like this product but it is limited to basic gestures. 1. Moving mouse cursor 2. One finger touch 3. Two finger tap 4. Double click 5. Tag and Drop 6. Vertical Scroll 7. Zoom in/out. It does lag and it takes patients because it is very small. This would be an alternative for steaming for playing simple games instead of using your mouse. In addition, once you plug it in it is ready to go. I would also say its to pricey for what you get. You could get a keyboard with touchpad around the same price and blue tooth capability. This is just wired.
customer_reviews.author: Rogelio

customer_reviews.title: Mouse pad is too sensitive.
customer_reviews.text: Product doesn’t not respond well to finger movement. You barely move your finger and the mouse arrow will move through the whole screen with little control. The double tap or right click option on the touch part is also very sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Bobert

customer_reviews.title: Saved me when HP Envy touchpad died
customer_reviews.text: A little over a year ago, I purchased a nice, large HP Envy laptop. Unfortunately, it wasn't as 'nice' as it seemed and within less than a year, the touchpad died. I've been using this Perixx pad for about three months now. It's easy to use and works well. The pad is smooth, the cord is long and you don't have to use the pad on a hard surface. It's about half the size of the HP touchpad but I don't have any issues with that. Overall, for the price, I'm happy with it for general, day to day laptop use.
customer_reviews.author: Terri P

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: I had seen a lot of good reviews for this touchpad, so I ordered one to hopefully switch between for casual computer use and the more demanding precision tasks with a higher quality mouse. The touch pad does not have features that can be disabled, such as certain patterns of tapping that would cause dragging and selection using the mouse cursor, that were unintended. I tried giving it a shot for several hours to see if I could get used to how I had to train myself to stop these unwanted inputs, but it was to no avail. I think my next option is to try a Wacom tablet instead.
customer_reviews.author: Alucard212

customer_reviews.title: If operating in Microsoft Windows....
customer_reviews.text: .... you have two main options regarding motion of the pointer. First is the pointer speed.... simple right?! And the second is the "Enhanced Pointer Precision" option. My suggestion is to toggle this box ON and test the trackpad AND toggle the box OFF and test the trackpad. You will find that the trackpad will behave very differently depending if the box is checked or not! If you use a mouse to "Drag Items" frequently then a trackpad will not feel as natural a mouse however the positives outweigh the negatives for my application. I have found my comfort zone settings with speed and precision and I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: A handy accessory for gamers.
customer_reviews.text: I have Carpal Tunnel Syndrome in both hands and clicking a mouse puts my hand to sleep and becomes painful. Some of the games I play require a lot of clicking, so with this touchpad, I just have to tap it and it does the click for me. Now I can play my games without causing hand pain. It is not quite as sensitive as the ones on a laptop, but overall it is good enough, so I am happy with it. I bought 2; one for my wife and myself.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky M

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, functional, small
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pointing device that can fit my requirements: a SMALL touchpad that goes between me and my keyboard. I tried the Ergo Touchpad, but it has an erratic touch that made it useless. This one doesn't have that problem. While the gestures may be a bit hard to perform using two fingers on this pad, it's not a major problem. I don't believe I've ever used the two buttons, as the touches are that accurate. I wouldn't say this can completely replace a mouse, as I am still using a mouse WITH this, but for $20, it is a great little tool.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Reviews Romance and MoreTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very small touchpad
customer_reviews.text: I needed a very small touch pad or trackball, to fit to the right of a keyboard (having no numeric pad) in a pull-out keyboard drawer in an equipment rack. Trackballs are too high, so a touchpad is needed. The Perixx fits the space perfectly and operates well. My only wish would be for its cable to come out at the top of the unit, rather than the RHS. I use it with the buttons at the bottom - but there is space for the cable!
customer_reviews.author: Peter H. Beckett

customer_reviews.title: Remote touch-pad "mouse" operation - so so
customer_reviews.text: Unit is rather light weight, so if you use this on a keyboard shelf, it easily moves around the table surface when you try to "mouse around". Rather sluggish response to scrolling through PDF document pages (but this is probably due to using a slow computer). I just know it "functions" but from my setup and situation - am not overly impressed. I can't give any outstanding recommendation, but it does provide the basic functions I would expect from a touch pad device.
customer_reviews.author: J. Klyman

customer_reviews.title: Annoying to use & unsupported by manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this, but it's /way/ too sensitive and erratic. I use a mouse when I work, so I don't want to change my setting through windows. The scroll gesture works the opposite of the trackpad on my laptop, which is driving me insane. Manufacturer doesn't have drivers or a manual for this product on their website, so I can't find a way to correct these issues. And, honestly, it just feels very cheap! I plan to return this and try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: It works well for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I needed a trackpad where I can't use a mouse. I wouldn't want to use this all the time, but I have it hooked up to a PC that I usually only used with a gaming controller. I wish the cord came out the other side, and it is light and moves around easily. Maybe I can velcro it. That isn't the product's fault. It works well enough. It feels a little cheap but it works fine. It is better than an $80 keyboard with a built-in trackpad.
customer_reviews.author: Thanatopsis

customer_reviews.title: it worked, but not well.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use on my desktop computer because I was starting to have some RSI issues from using the mouse. Long story short, I had to return it, at least 90% of the reason being it just wasn't consistent when it came to mouse movement. I'd swipe my finger across it and sometimes it would go the distance you'd expect, and sometimes it would abruptly stop halfway. Scrolling was also difficult with this pad. I've had a number of laptops over the years and never had such problems with a touchpad. I can't recommend this if your computing experience is important to you.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Learning how to use it
customer_reviews.text: I have a sore wrist and bought this to use to save wear and tear on my wrist. It does require learning how to use! It seems to work the same as on my MacBook Pro, but doesn't scroll as well as the MacBook. (I am using this track pad on my computer at work, which has Windows 10 as an OS). I suspect that when this track pad doesn't scroll (which happens far too often) that it might be a Windows 10 issue. I will continue to learn and tinker with it, but so far, I would give it a "C" grade...
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Brinton

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play.
customer_reviews.text: This really came in handy after I had surgery on both of my hands. I was only able to use my thumbs so it was pretty hard to stay occupied with anything. This allowed me to keep working on some designs I was doing in 3dcad and anything else I needed to on my computer. Sturdy construction, cord is nice and long and it is plug in and use, easy.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, allowing cursor control and right and left click functions just like a mouse. I'm using it on a security system monitor where I've no room for a mouse pad, and it is doing just fine; actually easier than the mouse was. I think some of the negative comments might be considered under the common misunderstanding of hating a nickel for not being a quarter.
customer_reviews.author: Master Luthier Lipman

customer_reviews.title: Pain free wrist! Hooray!
customer_reviews.text: Ahhhh my wrist!!! I was using a tracker ball mouser until I developed tendonitis in my right wrist. Oh the pain! But not with this little gem. This is very easy to use, just plug it in and it works! You can adjust the sensitivity setting in Windows to fit your needs. It is small, which I like. It was difficult to ind one that was not too large. This is just the right size to fit in front of my keyboard. It doesn't really scroll like t tracker ball mouse or scroll wheel though.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly_Que

customer_reviews.title: The touchpad is truly mouse compatible
customer_reviews.text: This touchpad is truly mouse compatible since it is the only one I found that actually works with every type of device that requires a standard mouse. The ratings for the product are good, but there is some Amazon programmer pervert who thinks it is funny to add a "sheerness" rating. "Sheerness" refers to a woman getting raped and customers do not find that amusing.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: No adjustable settings - pointer is jittery when using this
customer_reviews.text: About the EXTENDED version. There are no adjustable settings.. the pointer moves very fast and is very jittery. If there was a way to adjust the speed of the pointer this would be great.. but there isn't. Honestly.. it's almost unusable as is.
customer_reviews.author: CRI

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with Stuck "Right Click" button
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this touch pad mouse. It is "plug & play" so it installed easily, but mine flashes the 'right-click' menu every time I touch the screen. It's like the "right click" button is just stuck on. I believe mine is defective and will return it. This touch pad is all plastic, with stiff "click" buttons, and it has a cheap feel. I hope other people have a better experience with this than I did. If the only thing you plan to do with this is select the "right-click" button. This is the touch pad for you. LOL!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanann

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Not the smoothest control and not the most accurate, and a bit chunky (i.e. could be thinner/flatter) but not bad. Money well spent, given the price. Multitouch does work, which is a step up over my older touchpad, and that's what I wanted..
customer_reviews.author: culture vulture

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Raspberry Pi
customer_reviews.text: I plugged it into my Raspberry Pi 3B and it worked automagically. It's not quite as tiny as I'd hoped (I mean the case around the touchpad), and the cord is a little cumbersome to fit in my project, but I'd appreciate its length in a different project. Overall, it's smooth and responsive. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin L. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: The precious piece for the computers that don't have touchpad!!!
customer_reviews.text: This touchpad is wonderful! My husband couldn't believe that such thing existed! His computer does't have touchpad and he doesn't like the mouse (he's left hand and doesn't have control of the mouse.) Now he's in heaven! Thank you very much for inventing such a precious piece for the computers that don't have touchpad.
customer_reviews.author: Adelaide Davis

customer_reviews.title: Solid option for non-traditional mouse users
customer_reviews.text: I am glad that I purchased this to use instead of a traditional mouse. It can be a bit finicky sometimes (but not too often). My big wish is that there were a driver to allow for customization and more features, specifically the ability to customize what the L button, R button, and touchpad do individually (as opposed to just a right-handed or left-handed setup).
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Gal

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: The track pad works as it is supposed to. I don't find it as easy and quick to use as a mouse. Also it doesn't work for things like highlighting a line of text to copy. So it isn't a complete substitute for a mouse. I have it and a mouse plugged in so I can use both devices.
customer_reviews.author: WNC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent touchpad
customer_reviews.text: Read descriptions carefully. I purchased a different touchpad which was a failure. This is is an outstanding difference. I find it an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Roscoe Dan

customer_reviews.title: Bummer: Have to click buttons like a mouse.
customer_reviews.text: My touchpad on my new laptop is not working well. I was hoping this would be an alternative. I was disappointed. It is cheap...It works, but it is not a good quality...you have to swipe and the move your finger to click the buttons like a mouse to select things. I am not sure why a “touchpad user” would not just use a mouse based on the way you have to lift your finger to click it like a mouse? It came quickly, packaged well, and worked...it was just not a replacement for my high quality functioning touchpad...and I will use a mouse until my tech department is functioning and can repair my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie V

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play, works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works great right out of the box! I needed to try a touchpad because the roller thing on the mouse at work had caused me to develop a very painful overuse injury to my right hand/index finger. I am only taking away a star because it is so tiny. I will likely have to get a larger one but am hoping I can get used to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Haessler

customer_reviews.title: smooth mousepad
customer_reviews.text: Perfect addition to a desktop or laptop. I use to play Android games through bluestacks. Using it to zoom out is tricky. But I use my keyboard and regular mouse for that. It installed easily and drivers are on point. It's good as a replacement for games that require a touch screen. Using a mouse pad makes it so much smoother
customer_reviews.author: Sav86838

customer_reviews.title: Practial and simple
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what is supposed to do in a very simple way. I am still getting used to the accuracy and sensitivity of the clicks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent, if a little limited
customer_reviews.text: Touchpad works fine for most use cases. The buttons have a good positive click when depressed and taps, zooms, two-finger and other gestures work well. Doesn’t support natural scrolling
customer_reviews.author: Jake North

customer_reviews.title: Just so so, not quite worth it
customer_reviews.text: I'm not impressed, maybe I'm spoiled by the touchpad on apple's macbook pro and still need more time to get used to this one. Touch accuracy is the first issue. What I find really annoying is the over-sensitive triggering of certain gestures in windows 10, but I didn't find a place to configure or disable the gestures. For the same price, a wireless mouse can work much better.
customer_reviews.author: Texas

customer_reviews.title: great for a tight space
customer_reviews.text: Added the pad to my flight simulator because it fit perfectly behind the joystick without a mousepad or big trackball.
customer_reviews.author: Richard VanTreuren

customer_reviews.title: Good if you have arthritis
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom because she was having trouble using a mouse with her arthritis. It has worked out perfect. She loves being able to use it in her lap and it doesn't strain her wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela S

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I have numb hands and this makes my life on the computer so much easier. I have great difficulty using a mouse these days and this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Belford

customer_reviews.title: Good item.
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I expected. (yes i saw the dimensions.) As a whole. Works like you would expect it would. Can't always get the tap to work either with finger or nail. Works on my kodi box fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: A little thick, but functional
customer_reviews.text: For an extra challenge, I sometimes game on my laptop trackpads, and I wanted a similar experience on my desktop. This trackpad is a little thick. Much less expensive than the other thinner options, does basically the same thing
customer_reviews.author: Winterine

customer_reviews.title: Works with Linux
customer_reviews.text: I tried it with a Linux system, and it's a little slow to respond sometimes, but it works well enough. And nothing special was required to get it operating. I plugged it in and it worked. There's no convenient way to customize or modify the operation though---you get what you get. It has a small footprint which is handy for crowded desktops.
customer_reviews.author: Once in a while

customer_reviews.title: Hypersensitive.
customer_reviews.text: It often zooms or selects when I don't really want to do that. I've been using it for a couple of weeks now and I still find it impossible always to avoid these unintended actions.
customer_reviews.author: h

customer_reviews.title: It's a very good touchpad.
customer_reviews.text: It does not jump around like the wireless ones I've been using - so I can type fast without worries that it transposed my sentences. Wish the cord was on the left - my biggest complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Seamus

customer_reviews.title: Since aside from tapping vertical scroll is the control I use most often with a touchpad this makes this device nearly useless.
customer_reviews.text: Description states "One-touch Vertical Scroll Feature", however this feature is not present in current model as confirmed by vendor. You cannot scroll by sliding your finger down the edge. Since aside from tapping vertical scroll is the control I use most often with a touchpad this makes this device nearly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Sky

customer_reviews.title: Buy this
customer_reviews.text: Works just as effectively as the alternative for half the price. Touch surface is more textured by design but I didn't find this to be an issue. What does take some adjustment is the fact that the buttons don't roll over the front of the device but are positioned flat on top. This was a minor inconvenience that I quickly adjusted to. One and two finger taps provides an alternative to the buttons. Simple, basic gestures on the touch surface are supported and work well.
customer_reviews.author: JQP!@#

customer_reviews.title: Good touchpad.
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I wanted and needed. I don't have room for a mouse on my work desk, and I love touchpads. It is just as good as the ones I used to get back in the day.
customer_reviews.author: JLS RN

customer_reviews.title: Great value and price ... a bit small
customer_reviews.text: I didn't feel like spending much so this product was cheap compared to everything else. I had hesitations, but after using it for a day so far, it feels responsive. It is a bit small, but you can't complain considering the price. All in all I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: X. Hong

customer_reviews.title: Lousy and Unpredictable
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk. It 's very unpredictable and hard to control. It's constantly reading some kind of gesture that moves windows around but I can't reproduce it.
customer_reviews.author: Guy in Philly

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: The touch pad works very well - exactly like the built in ones on a lap top. It is small enough to place next to my keyboard on my keyboard drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia N

customer_reviews.title: love it for a replacement of Synaptic on laptop.
customer_reviews.text: so , so much better than the synaptic pad on HP laptops. Highly recommend. Easy to use gliding, clicking as good as a mouse, cord is very long .
customer_reviews.author: rap. polikof

customer_reviews.title: From ball to pad
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I only gave ya 4 out of 5 for ease of use but that's not your product... It's ME! I've used a trackball for years and it'll take me a little while to to feel natural. I do like it though. Thanks for asking ☺
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Fuller

customer_reviews.title: worked better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after the touch pad that on my Dell laptop stopped responding. I really like the fact you do not need to install any software; just plug it in and your set...it really is that easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. Morison

customer_reviews.title: Not a precision mousepad
customer_reviews.text: Works fine as a replacement to a mouse, but doesn't show up as a precision touchpad in Windows 10, so it does not support pinch to zoom like a modern touchpad.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Good but overly sensitive
customer_reviews.text: Good pad, handy. The click buttons are absurdedly sensitive, a hard jab to the table the pad is sitting on is enough to make it click
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Incognito

customer_reviews.title: So Inaccurate It Hurts
customer_reviews.text: This trackpad is absolute garbage. It registers phantom touches randomly and sometimes barely moves and sometimes moves across both monitors instantly. This product is worse than useless. Oh and don't think it's good for scrolling, it isn't. Sometimes it wont scroll, sometimes 10 pages instantly. Sometimes it spams the right-click menu a hundred times and sometimes it simply doesn't register any contact at all.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Useful cheap solution for the not working mouse-pad
customer_reviews.text: This became very handy when my laptop mouse pad stopped working. The wire is a little bit long for me, could be half length. Otherwise great find!
customer_reviews.author: Bogirina

customer_reviews.title: Does what it supposed to!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after a disappointing experience with Logitech T650 (could not tap to click on T650) so I am pleased it works without a hitch. It didn't get 5 stars because if texture (touch surface;) and overall build (seems less substantial- falls off desk easily, e.g). But it works as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Sydonie

customer_reviews.title: portable track pad usb for laptop
customer_reviews.text: item works great very accurate tracking works very well with my computer great product fast shipping highly recommend this seller
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT J COLLIER

customer_reviews.title: Tired fingers/wrists?
customer_reviews.text: This product can be utilized as an alternate mouse for People that experience long work hours and need to change hand position/usage, highly sensitive to clicking and screen navigation, Nice!
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my job at work because the regular mouse gives me wrist problems. It performs well for the most part. I have only had a slight problem with the buttons, every now and then. If I wouldn't have bought this, I wouldn't even be able to continue to job, the pain was so great (with the regular mouse).
customer_reviews.author: Cart

customer_reviews.title: I wish they would have made this a little bigger and of a better quality, if they come up with a better ...
customer_reviews.text: Because of my hand and mouse finger pain I have purchased many type of mice and none of them fix my issue until I found this wonder, I can now use my computer all day without the pain, I wish they would have made this a little bigger and of a better quality, if they come up with a better version even if more expensive I would definitely buy it
customer_reviews.author: G. Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Touchpad
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my regular computer. One has to get used to it. Small in size but better then a regular mouse for hand strains. Not bad!
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Good Backup to Your Laptop’s Touchpad
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a mouse guy, so when my laptop’s touchpad started to fail a couple months before my company was due to issue a new one, I bought this as a backup. Works exactly as advertised, with the laptop immediately finding and installing the required software automatically. I’ll keep this as a backup for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this trackpad, but it wouldn't even scroll properly. It was a waste of my money. :(
customer_reviews.author: LSK

customer_reviews.title: value
customer_reviews.text: I am sometimes frugal and love to save a buck or two -- this will be good to your wallet. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Poppy

customer_reviews.title: Even better than touchpads included with touchpad keyboards
customer_reviews.text: This touchpad is a must for anyone who has ANY wrist pain, whether Carpal Tunnel, muscle fatigue, or sore tendons from using a mouse. Stop the pain before you need expensive surgery and months of rehab. The buttons and the touchpad area are larger than those built into most touchpad keyboards. Use your desktop computer the same as you use your laptop. Since this is a USB device, you can keep your mouse if it does not cause you pain, and simply use whichever device best suits the task at hand.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Schennberg

customer_reviews.title: This is a value-mouse in touchpad form factor - NOT a precision touchpad
customer_reviews.text: Windows 10 sees this device as a USB mouse - NOT a precision touchpad. Item description is vague. So, this is a $20 'ergonomic' mouse and NOT really a touchpad (as seen by the PC). Works for what it is but that's about it. Also, there is an undocumented 'middle click' accessible via a three-finger tap.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne G. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: satisfied
customer_reviews.text: pretty good laptop feel just wish it had a better grip to reduce movement on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Ever V.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for a week but the pad works great and is very easy to use. I have pain in my right index finger knuckle and joint from what I believe was caused by using a traditional mouse. My pain is still there but I now use both hands to move the curser which gives my index finger a rest. Great little unit.
customer_reviews.author: GlennG

customer_reviews.title: very good mouse repacement
customer_reviews.text: i hate when my mouse skips. i had much fewer skips with this pad. very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Waasano

customer_reviews.title: small pad.
customer_reviews.text: smaller than I expect. but easy to use. enough touch sensitive so you dont need to press down the surface. touch surface bit small, so it is slightly hard to use for multi finger gesture.
customer_reviews.author: SJ LEE

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my wife to use at work Since ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife to use at work Since I have not heard any complaints It must work great
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Vallarino

customer_reviews.title: Great little touch pad
customer_reviews.text: Well made touchpad at a good price. I'm using it out in the shop with the computer controlling a CNC mill. Works perfectly--only annoyance is that the "tap to click" is a little bit too sensitive and occasionally I get an unwanted click. Usually not a problem, but when controlling a machine tool it's undesirable. Haven't researched to see if the tap-to-click can be disabled.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Ste Marie

customer_reviews.title: a bit slow
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted it so she could keep from accidentally bumping the mouse on her Dell. It helps, but we need to speed it up through the computer. For the money, it is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Joel S. Gottlieb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: It's the same size as my laptop touchpad. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jiffy 5200

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: It works as well as the touchpad on my laptop. I’m very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Kansas

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mouse so that I could alter my workspace to accommodate a temporary injury to my arm. Works as advertised. Easy to set up & use.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Ann

customer_reviews.title: Touch pad mouse is best mouse. (traditional mice hurt my hand/wrist more)
customer_reviews.text: Delivered as promised. Plug & play worked no problemo. Response smooth after adjustments in settings>mouse. Definitely recommend especially as the price is more attractive than other corded mice. (I need an attached mouse because my laptop's touch pad buttons don't respond & a blue tooth mouth w/disappear because Cat.)
customer_reviews.author: O'Muse

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: It is a laptop sized tracking pad. But useful in certain situations.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Norris

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the placement of the right click button
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the placement of the right click button. I have to keep shifting my hand to use it. I like the scrolling function, but the left click means I can't use it for most games.
customer_reviews.author: Arakinas

customer_reviews.title: Only for Windows
customer_reviews.text: My pain condition means I need to use two mice so this product works for me. It is not 'plug and play', and is designed for Windows OS.
customer_reviews.author: S. Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. The non-slip back of the touchpad is very helpful. The overall accuracy of the touchpad is great, even on a 4k dual-monitor setup. The touch sensitivity is perfect for me to move efficiently within a screen and across various monitors.
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting used to it at work. The touch and the L and R clicks are fine. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: LSF

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but slightly smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old son has limited mobility and we needed a touchpad he could have on his lap. This one works well and is of sturdy materials. It suits our uses very nicely. I just wish it was a tad larger like a laptop touchpad. Other than that, it is great!
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great I just didnt realize how small it was
customer_reviews.author: stormy

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great product. Other touch pads are way more expensive. Sometimes I have issues when selecting text. But 90% of the time it selects text just fine. Love the way it scrolls with 2 fingers. My hand is a more comfortable with this than a mouse or track ball.
customer_reviews.author: wjlm3

customer_reviews.title: A reasonably priced alternative to a mouse
customer_reviews.text: A traditional mouse was causing some pain in my hand. Decided to try this touchpad. It does taking some adjustments in sensitivity under Windows settings and some getting use to it, but it works right out of the box and is much easier on the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Randall J. Maurer

customer_reviews.title: This is an ok but not great replacement.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my teenage son accidentally dropped his laptop. Everything else worked except the mouse. He plays games with the touchpad. This is an ok but not great replacement.
customer_reviews.author: AprilE

customer_reviews.title: Nice tracpad
customer_reviews.text: Works better than the one that came installed on my notebook. Fits on top of the old one (must remove it before closing the cover).
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: It is a trackpad, what else can I say, I plugged it in and it worked. Very Happy with my selection. It has extra features that are nice.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Fox

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely for normal usage on Deepin Linux, no absolute coordinates
customer_reviews.text: I had originally planned to use this touchpad to play osu! via a program that I coded, but this touchpad doesn't report absolute coordinates, so it doesn't work. I'm still rating 5 stars because it otherwise works perfectly for normal usage on Deepin 15.11.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Beale

customer_reviews.title: Good external trackpad
customer_reviews.text: My son doesn't like using a mouse, so when we purchased a desktop for home I purchased this. Quick delivery, easy plug and play, good responsiveness. It takes a little getting used compared to using a laptop trackpad, but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: DGillette

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice small trackpad
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice small trackpad; the buttons give a firm click when pressed, very responsive and works fine on the Windows 10 system I attached it to. The pad "feel" is not perfectly smooth, more like a slightly textured plastic, but it's not an issue for me. I think it's a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sushil K. Rudranath

customer_reviews.title: Resting hand with mouse ( would go to sleep )
customer_reviews.text: Scroll-pad on computer, effected my typing badly, scroll-pad on desk works great
customer_reviews.author: E. Gordon Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Works well. My only complaint is that it does ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. My only complaint is that it does not have left to right scrolling. It does have up and down scrolling (one finger) on the right side of the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A.

customer_reviews.title: USB Touch Pad
customer_reviews.text: I've only hd it a couple of days, but it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Donald W. Beyer

customer_reviews.title: Several of these arrived DOA
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for use with some computers at work. About 40% arrived DOA, and several others died after a few weeks of use. Although they were replaced, I just would not bother with these again.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have it installed along with a wireless keyboard and mouse. No conflicts on my system so I can use either the mouse or the touchpad. Very satisfied with the unit and price.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied User

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: This touchpad is pretty basic, but it does what it is supposed to do. The cord is on the right side and gets in my way. I would prefer the cord on the top.
customer_reviews.author: wheeler

customer_reviews.title: One-finger tap makes it unusable
customer_reviews.text: The one-finger tap feature is so sensitive that you'll be accidentally clicking on everything. Would be a great touchpad if you could turn this annoying feature off but you can't.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Marocco

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works without drivers on raspberry pi. It's price point and size make it ideal for medium sized projects.

customer_reviews.title: You don't need any drivers for windows 10 just plug it in and play.
customer_reviews.text: I love it and I use it for playing multiplayer games in real time.
